Outstanding.You'll need a reservation, and it's a tiny little place in Barcelona's old city, but it is worth it!  Everything is good, especially the Moroccan lamb!  Also delicious were the honey-mustard ribs, and the beef cheeks.It's a cozy little place that feels like a chef's home kitchen.  You will get to know the other patrons dining with you, since it's a tight squeeze, but that's part of the fun.Enjoy!
